MPM.content: de Man: “art leaves interiorization of past forever behind” > no dialectical passage from symbol to sign; art (like thought of thinking memory) linked to sign not symbol
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: “art leaves interiorization of past forever behind” > no dialectical passage from symbol to sign; art (like thought of thinking memory) linked to sign not symbol

MC.content: symptōma in Greek, first meant sinking, depression, then meant coincidence, event, finally meant sign, illness [finitude]
MC.linkedContent: symptōma in Greek, first meant sinking, depression, then meant coincidence, event, finally meant sign, illness [finitude]

MC.content: Derrida says mark, trace rather than signifier, letter, word, or the generality of stoikheion—to extend mark beyond verbal sign, beyond human language (and beyond atomism) > thus he does not affirm “arbitrariness of sign” like Hegel, Saussure
MC.linkedContent: Derrida says mark, trace rather than signifier, letter, word, or the generality of stoikheion—to extend mark beyond verbal sign, beyond human language (and beyond atomism) > thus he does not affirm “arbitrariness of sign” like Hegel, Saussure

SEC.content: careful use of “ideological” in relation to Condillac: theory of sign as representation of idea, which represents a perceived thing; communication vehiculates a representation as ideal content (which will be called meaning); writing as species w/in genus of communication
SEC.linkedContent: careful use of “ideological” in relation to Condillac: theory of sign as representation of idea, which represents a perceived thing; communication vehiculates a representation as ideal content (which will be called meaning); writing as species w/in genus of communication

SEC.content: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being
SEC.linkedContent: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being

SEC.content: Husserl on possibility of absence of referent: 1) “sky is blue” is understood w/ out presence of sky 2) absence of signified, possible crisis of meaning: a) manipulate symbols b) statements can have meaning w/out objective signification, i.e. “square circle” c) Sinnlosigkeit or agrammaticality, i.e. “green is or,” “abracadabra”
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl on possibility of absence of referent: 1) “sky is blue” is understood w/ out presence of sky 2) absence of signified, possible crisis of meaning: a) manipulate symbols b) statements can have meaning w/out objective signification, i.e. “square circle” c) Sinnlosigkeit or agrammaticality, i.e. “green is or,” “abracadabra”

SEC.content: Husserl uses above to rigorously dissociate sign or expression (Ausdruck) as signifying sign from a sign meaning something (bedeutsame Zeichen)
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl uses above to rigorously dissociate sign or expression (Ausdruck) as signifying sign from a sign meaning something (bedeutsame Zeichen)

SEC.content: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality

SEC.content: in French “le vert est ou” can become “le vert est où” or “le verre est où”
SEC.linkedContent: in French “le vert est ou” can become “le vert est où” or “le verre est où”

SEC.content: Austin doesn’t think everything covered under problematic heading “arbitrariness of the sign” [see OG for deconstruction of “arbitrary”]
SEC.linkedContent: Austin doesn’t think everything covered under problematic heading “arbitrariness of the sign” [see OG for deconstruction of “arbitrary”]

VM.content: forever discreet, interrupting all historical totalities through its freedom of speech, face not “of this world”
VM.linkedContent: forever discreet, interrupting all historical totalities through its freedom of speech, face not “of this world”

VM.content: être derrière le signe qui est dans le monde, c’est ensuite demeurer invisible au monde dans l’épiphanie
VM.linkedContent: être derrière le signe qui est dans le monde, c’est ensuite demeurer invisible au monde dans l’épiphanie

VP.content: the security of presence is founded on the non-empirical, the sign, the non-foundation, exposing this removes this security
VP.linkedContent: the security of presence is founded on the non-empirical, the sign, the non-foundation, exposing this removes this security

VP.content: if the sign preceded truth & essence, it makes no sense to discuss truth or essence of sign
VP.linkedContent: if the sign preceded truth & essence, it makes no sense to discuss truth or essence of sign

VP.content: is sign not the sole thing which falls outside question “what is?” while producing this question
VP.linkedContent: is sign not the sole thing which falls outside question “what is?” while producing this question

VP.content: place difference of “sign” in the heart of the “originary”
VP.linkedContent: place difference of “sign” in the heart of the “originary”

VP.content: for Husserl, a sign is never an event if event means an “empirical singularity” that happens only “once,” is irreplaceable and irreversible > purely idiomatic sign would not be a sign
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, a sign is never an event if event means an “empirical singularity” that happens only “once,” is irreplaceable and irreversible > purely idiomatic sign would not be a sign

VP.content: since difference btwn reality and representation does not occur in the sign, that which sanctions the difference erases the sign
VP.linkedContent: since difference btwn reality and representation does not occur in the sign, that which sanctions the difference erases the sign

VP.content: two ways to erase sign, make it derivative: 1) simple presence before sign 2) trying to restore originality and non-derivation of sign w/in MOP
VP.linkedContent: two ways to erase sign, make it derivative: 1) simple presence before sign 2) trying to restore originality and non-derivation of sign w/in MOP

VP.content: presence as universal form of all existence, transgression of all empirical, and first of all mine, but even beyond my death, this present still is, must be to be universal; if the possibility of the sign is this relation to death: erasure of sign is dissimulation of this relation to death
VP.linkedContent: presence as universal form of all existence, transgression of all empirical, and first of all mine, but even beyond my death, this present still is, must be to be universal; if the possibility of the sign is this relation to death: erasure of sign is dissimulation of this relation to death

VP.content: if a sign is repetitive in structure, Husserl’s distinction btwn fictional usage and actual usage of sign is threatened
VP.linkedContent: if a sign is repetitive in structure, Husserl’s distinction btwn fictional usage and actual usage of sign is threatened

VP.content: for Husserl, sensible, corporeal thing is a “sign for itself”; isn’t that the same as not being a sign? present to itself w/out indicative detour?
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, sensible, corporeal thing is a “sign for itself”; isn’t that the same as not being a sign? present to itself w/out indicative detour?

VP.content: intimacy of non-presence and alterity w/ presence refutes argument about uselessness of sign in self-identity
VP.linkedContent: intimacy of non-presence and alterity w/ presence refutes argument about uselessness of sign in self-identity

PPHS.content: Hegel [Science of Logic]: sign, more precisely Sprache, fulfills spiritual function of middle (like water in nature)
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel [Science of Logic]: sign, more precisely Sprache, fulfills spiritual function of middle (like water in nature)

PPHS.content: restriction of difference, another name for medium of spirit
PPHS.linkedContent: restriction of difference, another name for medium of spirit

PPHS.content: semiology at center not margins of Hegel’s Logic
PPHS.linkedContent: semiology at center not margins of Hegel’s Logic

PPHS.content: sign as site of transition, bridge, btwn 2 moments of full presence [then relever of the bridge]
PPHS.linkedContent: sign as site of transition, bridge, btwn 2 moments of full presence [then relever of the bridge]

PPHS.content: process of sign has a history, signification is history comprehended: btwn original presence & its circular reappropriation in final presence
PPHS.linkedContent: process of sign has a history, signification is history comprehended: btwn original presence & its circular reappropriation in final presence

PPHS.content: time of sign is time of referral, refers presence to itself, sign organizes its own provisionality
PPHS.linkedContent: time of sign is time of referral, refers presence to itself, sign organizes its own provisionality

PPHS.content: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness
PPHS.linkedContent: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness

PPHS.content: sign facilitates Idea coming back to itself, return to self-presence
PPHS.linkedContent: sign facilitates Idea coming back to itself, return to self-presence

PPHS.content: sign derives from a finite determination of spirit, subjective spirit > finite is a transition (Übergegen) and an emergence (Übersichhinausgehen) watched over by Aufhebung and negativity
PPHS.linkedContent: sign derives from a finite determination of spirit, subjective spirit > finite is a transition (Übergegen) and an emergence (Übersichhinausgehen) watched over by Aufhebung and negativity

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, reproductive imagination (reproduktive Einbildungskraft) remains closed in on itself, self-identity of intelligence in passivity of impression [when simply received from pit]; productive imagination, the creation of signs, spirit as its own self-sprungness, but this sign is pure exteriorization of spirit, the scandalous idea of producing intuition
PPHS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, reproductive imagination (reproduktive Einbildungskraft) remains closed in on itself, self-identity of intelligence in passivity of impression [when simply received from pit]; productive imagination, the creation of signs, spirit as its own self-sprungness, but this sign is pure exteriorization of spirit, the scandalous idea of producing intuition

PPHS.content: concept of sign will be place where all contradictory characteristics (production, intuition) intersect > they are gathered in it, swallowed up within it (s’y engouffrent), and, somehow, something beyond the sign (interior/exterior, spontaneous/receptive, intelligible/sensible, same/other) is affirmed beneath the contradictions, as the contradictions, resolved in the dialectic
PPHS.linkedContent: concept of sign will be place where all contradictory characteristics (production, intuition) intersect > they are gathered in it, swallowed up within it (s’y engouffrent), and, somehow, something beyond the sign (interior/exterior, spontaneous/receptive, intelligible/sensible, same/other) is affirmed beneath the contradictions, as the contradictions, resolved in the dialectic

PPHS.content: Hegel: productive imagination as welding Mittelpunkt; Derrida remarks that Hegel could now extend the sign’s field infinitely, but he restricts it (refers it to indifference of imagination) by a movement/structure of dialectics that comprehends it [by the cunning of reason]
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: productive imagination as welding Mittelpunkt; Derrida remarks that Hegel could now extend the sign’s field infinitely, but he restricts it (refers it to indifference of imagination) by a movement/structure of dialectics that comprehends it [by the cunning of reason]

PPHS.content: “is dialectics the resolution of the sign in the horizon of the nonsign, of the presence beyond the sign?”
PPHS.linkedContent: “is dialectics the resolution of the sign in the horizon of the nonsign, of the presence beyond the sign?”

PPHS.content: for Hegel, sign is maintained only w/ sight set on truth
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, sign is maintained only w/ sight set on truth

PPHS.content: via Hegel, sign as unity of signifying body and signified ideality: incarnation
PPHS.linkedContent: via Hegel, sign as unity of signifying body and signified ideality: incarnation

PPHS.content: signifying intention (bedeuten) over body (signifier, from Cratylus, sēma/sōma (tomb/body), sign as tomb, prison) > Husserl, Saussure, Hegel
PPHS.linkedContent: signifying intention (bedeuten) over body (signifier, from Cratylus, sēma/sōma (tomb/body), sign as tomb, prison) > Husserl, Saussure, Hegel

PPHS.content: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]
PPHS.linkedContent: Derrida, through Hegel, describes tomb, family crypt (caveau), oikēsis, as the sign of death that capitalizes (thésaurise) on life by marking that life continues elsewhere, il la tient donc aussi à l’abri de la mort; at the heart of this monument, this sign of death, soul keeps itself alive, needs this works of death > the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]

PPHS.content: sign, as monument-of-life-in-death, is the pyramid
PPHS.linkedContent: sign, as monument-of-life-in-death, is the pyramid

PPHS.content: Hegel: the intuition (of sign), an image which has received (in sich empfangen hat) [like a woman receives in conceiving] as is soul and independent mental representation
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: the intuition (of sign), an image which has received (in sich empfangen hat) [like a woman receives in conceiving] as is soul and independent mental representation

PPHS.content: Hegel: sign, pyramid in which foreign soul has been conveyed, put-on deposit (versetsten) > non-anachronistic arbitrariness of sign
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: sign, pyramid in which foreign soul has been conveyed, put-on deposit (versetsten) > non-anachronistic arbitrariness of sign

PPHS.content: for Hegel, sign vs. symbol: symbol has identity w/ what it mimics, sign is foreign [relation of absolute alterity]
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, sign vs. symbol: symbol has identity w/ what it mimics, sign is foreign [relation of absolute alterity]

PPHS.content: despite symbol’s identity, sign’s arbitrariness is closer to independence, freedom of spirt than external, natural symbol [Saussure concurs in footnotes]
PPHS.linkedContent: despite symbol’s identity, sign’s arbitrariness is closer to independence, freedom of spirt than external, natural symbol [Saussure concurs in footnotes]

PPHS.content: Hegel: creative memory, mnēmosynē, freely bestows on sign a value that only has value conferred on it by spirit > [because sign is arbitrary, unlike symbol, it resonates w/ spirit, solely]
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: creative memory, mnēmosynē, freely bestows on sign a value that only has value conferred on it by spirit > [because sign is arbitrary, unlike symbol, it resonates w/ spirit, solely]

PPHS.content: authority of voice: coordinated w/ entire Hegelian system: its archeology, teleology, eschatology, its will to parousia > process of sign is an Aufhebung, negativity
PPHS.linkedContent: authority of voice: coordinated w/ entire Hegelian system: its archeology, teleology, eschatology, its will to parousia > process of sign is an Aufhebung, negativity

PPHS.content: sign erases itself for Hegel, but unlike for Derrida, preserves signified ideality, through passageway of time
PPHS.linkedContent: sign erases itself for Hegel, but unlike for Derrida, preserves signified ideality, through passageway of time

PPHS.content: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, signifying substance is sound, “substance of expression” [glossematicians], most proper to be produced as time itself, sound relève from naturalness, linked to spirit’s relation to itself, the voice

PPHS.content: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being
PPHS.linkedContent: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being

F.content: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing
F.linkedContent: every “word” that says Thing in word-thing > several subjects, places, instances; Wolf Man inhabits forbidden desire to call himself by glorious word, can’t not break seal in signing

DS.content: Mallarmé on example of the dancer: “through a kind of commerce whose secret her smile seems to pour forth, w/out delay she imparts to you, through the last veil that remains forever, the nudity of your own concepts, and silently proceeds to write your vision in the manner of a Sign, which she is”
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé on example of the dancer: “through a kind of commerce whose secret her smile seems to pour forth, w/out delay she imparts to you, through the last veil that remains forever, the nudity of your own concepts, and silently proceeds to write your vision in the manner of a Sign, which she is”

DS.content: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”
DS.linkedContent: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”

POS.content: the a of differance is a sign (signified/signifier): the mute intervention of a written sign found in all discourse
POS.linkedContent: the a of differance is a sign (signified/signifier): the mute intervention of a written sign found in all discourse

POS.content: a of differance, pyramid (A), tacit monument > for Hegel, body of sign compared to pyramid
POS.linkedContent: a of differance, pyramid (A), tacit monument > for Hegel, body of sign compared to pyramid

POS.content: concept of sign as impediment & progress, has “logocentric & ethnocentric limits”
POS.linkedContent: concept of sign as impediment & progress, has “logocentric & ethnocentric limits”

POS.content: Saussure resigns himself to using word “sign”
POS.linkedContent: Saussure resigns himself to using word “sign”

POS.content: semiological science will never cease to quest for “transcendental signified,” due to link btwn our language and history/system of metaphysics
POS.linkedContent: semiological science will never cease to quest for “transcendental signified,” due to link btwn our language and history/system of metaphysics

POS.content: concept of sign (signifier/signified) necessitates privileging phonic substance; phonē, given to consciousness, most intimately tied to thought of signified concept; linguistics, supposed to be just a part, becomes “pattern,” regulatory model for semiology: voice is consciousness itself
POS.linkedContent: concept of sign (signifier/signified) necessitates privileging phonic substance; phonē, given to consciousness, most intimately tied to thought of signified concept; linguistics, supposed to be just a part, becomes “pattern,” regulatory model for semiology: voice is consciousness itself

POS.content: semiology inscribed w/in psychologism: reduce everything exterior about signifier, all that’s left is psyche, the phonetic sign imposes itself as “pattern” for all signs
POS.linkedContent: semiology inscribed w/in psychologism: reduce everything exterior about signifier, all that’s left is psyche, the phonetic sign imposes itself as “pattern” for all signs

POS.content: Saussure: “linguistic sign is therefore a two-sided psychic entity”
POS.linkedContent: Saussure: “linguistic sign is therefore a two-sided psychic entity”

POS.content: psychologism inscribed/prescribed w/in concept of sign itself
POS.linkedContent: psychologism inscribed/prescribed w/in concept of sign itself

POS.content: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system
POS.linkedContent: gram as differance neutralizes phonologistic propensity of “sign,” liberates “graphic substance” > gram not an element, interwoven w/ traces of other elements of chain/system

ATIA.content: for Lacan, sign is still animal, it is the signifier that brings us to human subjectivity
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, sign is still animal, it is the signifier that brings us to human subjectivity

FS.content: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself
FS.linkedContent: Derrida links structuralist obsession w/ an anxiety (inquiétude) about (sur) language, an anxiety of (du) language and in (dans) language itself

FS.content: yet, to dream of reducing this link to a sign of the times is to dream of violence: the sign is more or less, something other than a sign of an epoch
FS.linkedContent: yet, to dream of reducing this link to a sign of the times is to dream of violence: the sign is more or less, something other than a sign of an epoch

DIF.content: classically, sign is treated as deferred presence, as differance of temporization > sign is thus provisional, secondary > Derrida questioning this logic: to think originary differance, one would have to recognize origin, archi-, telos, eskhaton have always denoted presence: ousia, parousia
DIF.linkedContent: classically, sign is treated as deferred presence, as differance of temporization > sign is thus provisional, secondary > Derrida questioning this logic: to think originary differance, one would have to recognize origin, archi-, telos, eskhaton have always denoted presence: ousia, parousia

DIF.content: differance not included in concept of a sign, which has always meant representation of a presence
DIF.linkedContent: differance not included in concept of a sign, which has always meant representation of a presence

DIF.content: Saussure, the thinker who made the arbitrary & differential character of sign inseparable, at very foundation of general semiology
DIF.linkedContent: Saussure, the thinker who made the arbitrary & differential character of sign inseparable, at very foundation of general semiology

CHM.content: the hermeneut, the analyst, must first know language of patient, the immediate materiality of sign (move from sign to signified, obvious meaning to latent)
CHM.linkedContent: the hermeneut, the analyst, must first know language of patient, the immediate materiality of sign (move from sign to signified, obvious meaning to latent)

CHM.content: if understood as a sign, does Descartes’ stated intention have the historical meaning assigned to it (by Foucault)? & is its meaning exhausted by its historicity?
CHM.linkedContent: if understood as a sign, does Descartes’ stated intention have the historical meaning assigned to it (by Foucault)? & is its meaning exhausted by its historicity?

Gii.content: [sign as gift?] Heidegger’s hand: holds, carries, welcomes, signs—presumably because man is a sign > (does Phenomenology of Spirit say anything different?)
Gii.linkedContent: [sign as gift?] Heidegger’s hand: holds, carries, welcomes, signs—presumably because man is a sign > (does Phenomenology of Spirit say anything different?)

Gii.content: writing is hand-writing in its essence, makes word manifest, monstre; co-belonging of hand & speech: ability to produce monstres that disclose concealment [still a phono-logocentrism, but one where handwriting is immediately bound to speech]
Gii.linkedContent: writing is hand-writing in its essence, makes word manifest, monstre; co-belonging of hand & speech: ability to produce monstres that disclose concealment [still a phono-logocentrism, but one where handwriting is immediately bound to speech]

Gii.content: Heidegger: w/ man, 2 hands fold into 1, auto-affect each other: prayer (man is a sign)
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: w/ man, 2 hands fold into 1, auto-affect each other: prayer (man is a sign)

Gii.content: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]
Gii.linkedContent: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]

WAP.content: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)
WAP.linkedContent: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)

REST.content: DS turns around points of ballerina, “la syntaxe du point et du pas” > each pair referring to some other, signifying too the operation of signifying
REST.linkedContent: DS turns around points of ballerina, “la syntaxe du point et du pas” > each pair referring to some other, signifying too the operation of signifying

AFR.content: if there are 2 concepts of imagination, there are 2 concepts/values of sign: 1) instrument of control, mastery 2) condition/instrument of exercising
AFR.linkedContent: if there are 2 concepts of imagination, there are 2 concepts/values of sign: 1) instrument of control, mastery 2) condition/instrument of exercising

AFR.content: Locke, acc. Condillac, missed the sign as principle of unfolding [sensible] germ, did not radically analyze germ/seed
AFR.linkedContent: Locke, acc. Condillac, missed the sign as principle of unfolding [sensible] germ, did not radically analyze germ/seed

AFR.content: after Condillac admits he had to take great detours, Derrida explains that the sign is the name of this detour, experience itself as detour, generation of suppléance to be retraced
AFR.linkedContent: after Condillac admits he had to take great detours, Derrida explains that the sign is the name of this detour, experience itself as detour, generation of suppléance to be retraced

AFR.content: for Condillac, chain of signs is superstructural, & its principle is formal
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, chain of signs is superstructural, & its principle is formal

AFR.content: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]

AFR.content: Condillac’s move from perception to imagination (and from one sign to another): on the march toward freedom, spontaneity of auto-affection > teleology: the complete sign, the true sign, is the instituted sign [after rupture, process magnetized toward greatest mastery possible]
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s move from perception to imagination (and from one sign to another): on the march toward freedom, spontaneity of auto-affection > teleology: the complete sign, the true sign, is the instituted sign [after rupture, process magnetized toward greatest mastery possible]

AFR.content: only arbitrary signs > sign’s active essence, its energy: freedom
AFR.linkedContent: only arbitrary signs > sign’s active essence, its energy: freedom

AFR.content: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”

AFR.content: frivolity (useless) is the congenital breach of sign (its entame, archē), since structure of sign’s deviation ensures frivolity has no origin, frivolity defies archeology, condemns it to frivolity: excessive relief, not even money or merchandise > sign’s disposability never presents itself
AFR.linkedContent: frivolity (useless) is the congenital breach of sign (its entame, archē), since structure of sign’s deviation ensures frivolity has no origin, frivolity defies archeology, condemns it to frivolity: excessive relief, not even money or merchandise > sign’s disposability never presents itself

AFR.content: though, acc. Condillac, articulated language as system of arbitrary signs is only 1 of 3 kinds of signs, once it proves the best example, exemplary, it draws, envelops in advance, everything which precedes it: upsets the symmetry to its own benefit [great example of exemplary]
AFR.linkedContent: though, acc. Condillac, articulated language as system of arbitrary signs is only 1 of 3 kinds of signs, once it proves the best example, exemplary, it draws, envelops in advance, everything which precedes it: upsets the symmetry to its own benefit [great example of exemplary]

AFR.content: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation

AFR.content: via Condillac, the sign’s vacancy (a frivolous one), suspension of its relation to object, intervenes before the sign: sign announced before sign
AFR.linkedContent: via Condillac, the sign’s vacancy (a frivolous one), suspension of its relation to object, intervenes before the sign: sign announced before sign

D.content: sign becomes what it is only through possibility of its reissue (sa réédition)
D.linkedContent: sign becomes what it is only through possibility of its reissue (sa réédition)

LI.content: Derrida suspicious of sign, of opposition signifier/signified

EL.content: for Heidegger & Scholem, when a “sign” regains its sacredness, history takes revenge [?]
EL.linkedContent: for Heidegger & Scholem, when a “sign” regains its sacredness, history takes revenge [?]

OG.content: [idea of] science and its nonphonetic characters an example of break from logo-phonocentrism, also made possible w/in phono-logocentric system, w/in a certain concept of the sign
OG.linkedContent: [idea of] science and its nonphonetic characters an example of break from logo-phonocentrism, also made possible w/in phono-logocentric system, w/in a certain concept of the sign

OG.content: crisis also a symptom: inflation of language, of sign “language,” inflation of sign itself, inflation itself > language’s historico-metaphysical epoch must determine totality of its problematic horizon, exposing its finitude when no longer self-assured, guaranteed (bordé), by infinite signified (which seemed to exceed it)
OG.linkedContent: crisis also a symptom: inflation of language, of sign “language,” inflation of sign itself, inflation itself > language’s historico-metaphysical epoch must determine totality of its problematic horizon, exposing its finitude when no longer self-assured, guaranteed (bordé), by infinite signified (which seemed to exceed it)

OG.content: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language
OG.linkedContent: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language

OG.content: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing
OG.linkedContent: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing

OG.content: secondarity of writing effects all signifieds
OG.linkedContent: secondarity of writing effects all signifieds

OG.content: advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign
OG.linkedContent: advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign

OG.content: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)
OG.linkedContent: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)

OG.content: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”
OG.linkedContent: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”

OG.content: to the question “what is the sign?” the answer has always been the signified, which is never contemporary, proximity to logos as phonè—presence: no relation to trace, signifier
OG.linkedContent: to the question “what is the sign?” the answer has always been the signified, which is never contemporary, proximity to logos as phonè—presence: no relation to trace, signifier

OG.content: what if sign escapes the instituting question of philosophy: “what is (ti esti)…?” what if we can only think of the sign as (is) [crossed-out] and (thing) [crossed-out, fixerup]? [Heidegger’s crossing-out]
OG.linkedContent: what if sign escapes the instituting question of philosophy: “what is (ti esti)…?” what if we can only think of the sign as (is) [crossed-out] and (thing) [crossed-out, fixerup]? [Heidegger’s crossing-out]

OG.content: at limit, if we try to claim the signifier is prior to the signified [reversing the classical structure], the whole concept of sign is destroyed
OG.linkedContent: at limit, if we try to claim the signifier is prior to the signified [reversing the classical structure], the whole concept of sign is destroyed

OG.content: to declare “primacy” of signifier w/in a logic that privileges the signified is absurd
OG.linkedContent: to declare “primacy” of signifier w/in a logic that privileges the signified is absurd

OG.content: transcendental signified: resource of sign, makes difference btwn signans/signatum absolute & irreducible > it is la voix s’entend: conscience, auto-affection (spontaneity, ideality, universality, non-mondain of substance)
OG.linkedContent: transcendental signified: resource of sign, makes difference btwn signans/signatum absolute & irreducible > it is la voix s’entend: conscience, auto-affection (spontaneity, ideality, universality, non-mondain of substance)

OG.content: Pierce’s sign w/ no final reference comes close to deconstruction, he complies w/ 2 incompatible exigencies w/out sacrificing one for the other > links symbol & sign, semiotics & logic: to think only in signs, is to ruin the notion of sign > the thing itself is a sign
OG.linkedContent: Pierce’s sign w/ no final reference comes close to deconstruction, he complies w/ 2 incompatible exigencies w/out sacrificing one for the other > links symbol & sign, semiotics & logic: to think only in signs, is to ruin the notion of sign > the thing itself is a sign

OG.content: (70, 74) substitute grammatology for semiology, le devenir-immotivé du symbole [via Pierce]: no more pertinence of synchronic/diachronic, and semiology no longer mastered by exemplary linguistic sign (master-sign)
OG.linkedContent: (70, 74) substitute grammatology for semiology, le devenir-immotivé du symbole [via Pierce]: no more pertinence of synchronic/diachronic, and semiology no longer mastered by exemplary linguistic sign (master-sign)

OG.content: Descartes drove out sign, Hegel reappropriates sensible sign to movement of Idea, but only Rousseau dealt directly w/ reduction of writing
OG.linkedContent: Descartes drove out sign, Hegel reappropriates sensible sign to movement of Idea, but only Rousseau dealt directly w/ reduction of writing

OG.content: for Rousseau, aesthetics passes through sign (semiology) not sensation, art is moral & ethnological [nonresponse to Western music can’t mean West Indians have different nerves!]
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, aesthetics passes through sign (semiology) not sensation, art is moral & ethnological [nonresponse to Western music can’t mean West Indians have different nerves!]

OG.content: light movement, chiquenaude, le doigt qui incline un monde, most eloquent model of sign (divine action), la baguette > actualizes virtual faculties dormant in man [is this God’s touch? Derrida includes varying degrees: perhaps not, perhaps, probably, certainly]
OG.linkedContent: light movement, chiquenaude, le doigt qui incline un monde, most eloquent model of sign (divine action), la baguette > actualizes virtual faculties dormant in man [is this God’s touch? Derrida includes varying degrees: perhaps not, perhaps, probably, certainly]

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, absolutely literal (propre) is at origin, the proper name, one sign per thing, one represented per passion
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, absolutely literal (propre) is at origin, the proper name, one sign per thing, one represented per passion

OG.content: proper names born in tandem w/ verbs (infinitive present) > degradation in their separation
OG.linkedContent: proper names born in tandem w/ verbs (infinitive present) > degradation in their separation

EU.content: Derrida sees arbitrariness of sign in both Descartes’ vision of an absolutely natural language & in an artificial code
EU.linkedContent: Derrida sees arbitrariness of sign in both Descartes’ vision of an absolutely natural language & in an artificial code

FV.content: Lacan is missing an elaboration of frame, signature, parergon > this lack permits scene of signifier to be reconstructed into a signified (inevitable process in logic of sign)
FV.linkedContent: Lacan is missing an elaboration of frame, signature, parergon > this lack permits scene of signifier to be reconstructed into a signified (inevitable process in logic of sign)
